words.definition: To accuse is to say that someone did something bad.
words.example: She accused him of stealing her favorite pen.

words.definition: To adjust is to change something slightly to make it better.
words.example: He adjusted his tie before the meeting.

words.definition: To amuse is to make someone laugh or smile.
words.example: The clown amused the children with his tricks.

words.definition: Coral is a hard substance formed from the skeletons of sea animals.
words.example: The coral reef was a beautiful place to go diving.

words.definition: Cotton is a soft fiber used to make clothes.
words.example: I prefer wearing clothes made of cotton.

words.definition: A crash is a violent accident involving vehicles.
words.example: There was a loud crash on the street outside.

words.definition: A deck is the floor of a ship.
words.example: We stood on the deck and watched the sunset.

words.definition: To engage in something is to take part in it.
words.example: He liked to engage in long conversations.

words.definition: If something is firm, it is hard and does not move.
words.example: The bed was very firm and comfortable.

words.definition: Fuel is something that is burned to produce heat or power.
words.example: The car ran out of fuel.

words.definition: When something is grand, it is big and liked by people.
words.example: The grand mountain rose high into the sky.

words.definition: A hurricane is a bad storm that happens over the ocean.
words.example: The wind from the hurricane bent the palm tree.

words.definition: A loss means the act or an instance of losing something.
words.example: I suffered a big loss while I was gambling.

words.definition: If something is simple, it is plain and not decorated.
words.example: He bought a pair of plain white shoes.

words.definition: A reef is a line of rocks or coral in the ocean.
words.example: The ship crashed into a coral reef.

words.definition: To shut something means to close it tight.
words.example: Please shut the door when you leave.

words.definition: If someone is strict, they make sure rules are followed.
words.example: The teacher is very strict about being on time.

words.definition: To surf is to ride on waves in the ocean.
words.example: He loves to surf when the waves are big.

words.definition: A task is a piece of work to be done.
words.example: My first task at work was to clean the office.

words.definition: A zone is an area that has different qualities from others.
words.example: This is a no-parking zone.
